170df0d496ad7596c0778518e5fa7aba6c32562522546f66b","dweb:/ipfs/QmR6B8nLj2PJf5e1JWD9Nk7ErkAwkqUwadCnvE82FJr1RU"]},"@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/Address.sol":{"keccak256":"0xf89f005a3d98f7768cdee2583707db0ac725cf567d455751af32ee68132f3db3","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://f963d438177764b5f43f637c02311c951c0f0025d12fe1ac7e62e295bf416c41","dweb:/ipfs/QmcfVb9JsWrYeTwFUJsKVHpKB7EaWBKydAH9S4sKg2pzcK"]},"@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/Context.sol":{"keccak256":"0x8d3cb350f04ff49cfb10aef08d87f19dcbaecc8027b0bed12f3275cd12f38cf0","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://ded47ec7c96750f9bd04bbbc84f659992d4ba901cb7b532a52cd468272cf378f","dweb:/ipfs/QmfBrGtQP7rZEqEg6Wz6jh2N2Kukpj1z5v3CGWmAqrzm96"]},"erc-payable-token/contracts/token/ERC1363/ERC1363.sol":{"keccak256":"0xd2898c74a081a21aa02c8260b02c25cc1fb817ef3d55f3c624ca39fa6964b476","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://45f68f608b4543156d3924b0e132eb1cdbecadfcfa250dc1b105f7e708cf8d47","dweb:/ipfs/QmXHB6fXYcUFRZcfKFgHSG6HXt9SygZ1pkJTfs88C1Qo47"]},"erc-payable-token/contracts/token/ERC1363/IERC1363.sol":{"keccak256":"0x5b074b4fcaff83d9cafe558834709adb59cb0d6e01e4256be6ba63798a0b7d69","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://ac0ed35f47a7692d9e0342a9bacc61fd75fc1ee212af62a3fa833d993328d8b2","dweb:/ipfs/QmaFXHQcoEqdsLhFaq676P4czKBKkQCjmk2ChjpevyNzg5"]},"erc-payable-token/contracts/token/ERC1363/IERC1363Receiver.sol":{"keccak256":"0x6514e4c25ad28a22646679d2b8ceddd343c524064a510ff4634d47aa35e946bf","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://8277a419b56819956556047ffb989cca8ab223b58160b994f05b5dcfef8bf36e","dweb:/ipfs/QmfG8YJ5zKLqPGZ6hcbUE3LoLG99w3B3xpVnbKQRHdP4zq"]},"erc-payable-token/contracts/token/ERC1363/IERC1363Spender.sol":{"keccak256":"0xf80b59d776d33df60dc8fcb6c498889041b323e868f827308f7e9100afc5de9a","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://c3536bdc42830b33aaf6099ab3d6362664f1cd835b4bf74f5e43652ea956beb0","dweb:/ipfs/QmWhzuZt92W5BLGiqTcb5vXXvwJ4Hscz6R9SV2SzjQZSvC"]}},"version":1}

documentation.text:
@param name Name of the token
 @param symbol A symbol to be used as ticker

attributes.text:
@param name Name of the token
 @param symbol A symbol to be used as ticker

approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

approveAndCall(address,uint256).details: Approve spender to transfer tokens and then execute a callback on recipient.

params.amount: The amount allowed to be transferred
params.spender: The address allowed to transfer to

returns._0: A boolean that indicates if the operation was successful.

approveAndCall(address,uint256,bytes).details: Approve spender to transfer tokens and then execute a callback on recipient.

params.amount: The amount allowed to be transferred.
params.data: Additional data with no specified format.
params.spender: The address allowed to transfer to.

returns._0: A boolean that indicates if the operation was successful.

params.name: Name of the token
params.symbol: A symbol to be used as ticker

decimals().details: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5,05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the value {ERC20} uses, unless {_setupDecimals} is called. NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`.

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: See {IERC165-supportsInterface}. Time complexity O(1), guaranteed to always use less than 30 000 gas.

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

transfer(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transfer}. Requirements: - `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`.

transferAndCall(address,uint256).details: Transfer tokens to a specified address and then execute a callback on recipient.

returns._0: A boolean that indicates if the operation was successful.

transferAndCall(address,uint256,bytes).details: Transfer tokens to a specified address and then execute a callback on recipient.

params.data: Additional data with no specified format

returns._0: A boolean that indicates if the operation was successful.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20}. Requirements: - `sender` and `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - `sender` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for ``sender``'s tokens of at least `amount`.

transferFromAndCall(address,address,uint.details: Transfer tokens from one address to another and then execute a callback on recipient.

params.amount: The amount of tokens to be transferred
params.recipient: The address which you want to transfer to
params.sender: The address which you want to send tokens from

returns._0: A boolean that indicates if the operation was successful.

transferFromAndCall(address,address,uint.details: Transfer tokens from one address to another and then execute a callback on recipient.

params.amount: The amount of tokens to be transferred
params.data: Additional data with no specified format
params.recipient: The address which you want to transfer to
params.sender: The address which you want to send tokens from

returns._0: A boolean that indicates if the operation was successful.
